name: df-lhyp
body: |- wceq(clh, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ccvr, cv(s0)), cfv(cp1, cv(s0))))))
comment: Define the set of lattice hyperplanes, which are all lattice elements covered by 1 (i.e., all co-atoms). We call them "hyperplanes" instead of "co-atoms" in analogy with projective geometry hyperplanes. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2012.)
